intro: Pfeifferago ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty pfeifferago, is a unique plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, reddish-brown stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, adding a subtle ornamental value. It is native to specific regions in South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
